meanings.definition: To convert something into a format suitable for the World Wide Web.
meanings.sent1: I will webify our company's brochure so it can be viewed online.
meanings.sent2: She decided to webify her portfolio to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The old recipe book was webified and now everyone can access it online.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were webified into a digital format for easy sharing.
meanings.sent5: The artist webified his paintings, making them available for online viewing.

meanings.definition: To make something accessible or available online.
meanings.sent1: Let's webify the training materials for remote employees.
meanings.sent2: The library webified their catalog for easy browsing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's daily adventures were webified for all to enjoy online.
meanings.sent4: She webified her music collection, creating a digital library.
meanings.sent5: The teacher webified the lesson plans for students to access from home.

meanings.definition: To integrate something into a website or online platform.
meanings.sent1: We need to webify the new chat feature into the website.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to webify the customer feedback form.
meanings.sent3: The robot's jokes were webified into the online chatbot.
meanings.sent4: She webified the booking system, making it easier for customers.
meanings.sent5: The game developer webified the multiplayer mode for online play.
